intro: Gymnotrix hordeoides, commonly known as the false barley, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family (Poaceae). It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a prominent midvein. Gymnotrix hordeoides is primarily cultivated as a forage crop due to its nutritional value for livestock.
